channel.title: Cheap Rig
channel.description:
I'm looking to buy a new computer in a few months, and I've been gaming for a while, but the variation of games has been limited because of my computer, for around £500, no monitor.
- I'm from the UK, so where's the best place to buy parts? - Has anyone got any recommendations on parts? - What is the maximum i could get for around £500?
Post any links for parts recommended please ;D.

item.title: Cheap Rig
item.dc:creator: @kaza Kaza
item.description:
@kaza wrote:

Graphics card works fine with motherboard, running them now.

I was originally going to buy a 9800GT, but then decided on a 4830 because of the price.

I’ll take a look at that motherboard, thanks :).
[/quote]

item.title: Cheap Rig
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

I looked up that video card on newegg, it seems a lot of people mentioned that is noisy…

I would recommend this.

Yea its 15$ more although there is a rebate not saying you should buy because of rebates but its there, and if you jump on it soon you can get COD4 and 5 with it. Theres some gaming for you…

That and its Nvidia instead of ATi

Edit:
Although that does mean you would have to find a different motherboard, one that has a Pci 2.0 x16 on it.

EditEdit:
The motherboard you have picked wont work for that ATi card anyway…that card also requires Pci 2.0 x16 even more reason to go with the nvidia card >.>

Editx3…:
Alright heres a good mobo its 10$ more though, but your going to need a different mobo regardless you pick the nvidia card or the ATI one.
Plus you can shove 8gb of ram into this mobo if you really feel thats necessary…the other one can only take 4.

So for (according to yahoo currency calc) 18~ euros more you get a better graphics card, and COD4 and 5

Yw

Read full topic

item.title: Cheap Rig
item.dc:creator: @kaza Kaza
item.description:
@kaza wrote:

I tried to lower the price by around £200, aiming for around £300.

I’m looking at;

Intel Core 2 Duo E7400
XFX ATI Radeon HD 4830
Corsair® 4GB DDR2
CoolerMaster Elite 335 ATX PC Case
Asus P5KPL-AM Intel G31
OCZ StealthXStream 500w Silent ATX2 Power Supply

I’m not wanting a hardcore rig, as I mostly play CS:S, but would like to be able to play more games, such as CoD4 etc. I won’t be playing Crysis, or any other graphically challenging games.

EDIT: Comes to £325 w/ VAT.

Read full topic

item.title: Cheap Rig
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:9, topic:277399”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=366077.msg2783496#msg2783496 date=1242326852]

from my experience buying a prebuilt computer is cheaper than building
also less troublesome

I don’t think that has ever been true ever.

If prices there are even close to prices here, you should be able to get a good gaming rig for that much money. I built my aunt one for $600 US about a month ago, and that is including a monitor.

a gaming rig? is your aunt a hardcore gamer in her spare time then?
[/quote]

My two cousins might want to play some games. While it is a gaming rig, all that would take for it to be a hardcore gaming rig would be another $100 or so on the video card.[/quote]
i was joking

Read full topic

item.description:

from my experience buying a prebuilt computer is cheaper than building
also less troublesome

I don’t think that has ever been true ever.

If prices there are even close to prices here, you should be able to get a good gaming rig for that much money. I built my aunt one for $600 US about a month ago, and that is including a monitor.
[/quote]
a gaming rig? is your aunt a hardcore gamer in her spare time then?[/quote]

My two cousins might want to play some games. While it is a gaming rig, all that would take for it to be a hardcore gaming rig would be another $100 or so on the video card.

item.title: Cheap Rig
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:6, topic:277399”]http://www.novatech.co.uk

Intel Quad Core Q6700 4 x 2.66Ghz (£142, It has a lower clock speed but it has double the cores)

Novatech

Intel Quad Core Q6700 4 x 2.66Ghz 8Mb Cache 1066 FSB Quad Core Processor OEM -...

Buy BX80562Q6700 OEM Intel Quad Core Q6700 4 x 2.66Ghz 8Mb Cache 1066 FSB Quad Core Processor OEM Stockcode : IL-Q6700O from Novatech

Asus P5KPL SE (£55)

Novatech

Asus P5KPL SE - Socket 775 -Intel G31 - DDR2 1066(O.C.)/800/667 - PCI-E (x16) -...

Buy P5KPL SE Asus P5KPL SE - Socket 775 -Intel G31 - DDR2 1066O.C./800/667 - PCI-E x16 - SATA - Gigabit Lan - ATX Stockcode : ASU-P5KPLS from Novatech

OCZ Reaper HPC 4GB (2x2GB) (£57)

Novatech

OCZ Reaper HPC 4GB (2x2GB) DDR2 PC-8500C5 1066MHz Dual Channel Kit - Novatech

Buy OCZ2RPR10664GK OCZ Reaper HPC 4GB 2x2GB DDR2 PC-8500C5 1066MHz Dual Channel Kit Stockcode : OCZ-85R4G from Novatech

And… If you can manage with 500W (which you might with that config) you can buy lots of cases with PSU for < £40[/quote]Quad isn’t really worth it for gaming (yet) I’d say go for a dualcore unless you are going to buy a high-end quad cpu.

item.title: Cheap Rig
item.dc:creator: @kaza Kaza
item.description:
@kaza wrote:

Atm, i’ve found this.

Intel Core 2 Duo E8400 - £140
Asus P5Q PRO P45 Socket 775 8 Channel Audio ATX Motherboard - £110
OCZ 4GB Kit (2x2GB) DDR2 1066MHz/PC2-8500 Reaper Memory HPC Edition Dual Channel - £60
Coolermaster Centurion 5 All Black Case + 550W eXtreme Power Plus PSU - £75

= £387.64

Which leaves £113 on a graphics card, as I could use current CD/DVD drives + HDD that I already have. If anyone has anything cheaper, post ;D.

  • Using eBuyer.

Read full topic
